sburjan - (09:41): sdumitriu, : posted screenshot to XAADMINISTRATION-155. Screenshot is from latest snapshot  
sdumitriu - (09:44): sburjan: Commented  
sburjan - (09:46): I see. Should I keep this open ?  
sburjan - (09:46): or won't fix  
sdumitriu - (09:46): Leave it open for the moment  
sburjan - (09:47): okay

sdumitriu - (11:09): vmassol: I think I fixed the AllDocs test (keyup)  
vmassol - (11:10): sdumitriu: oh that's great. What did you do?  
sdumitriu - (11:10): I changed the JS to also listen for onchange  
vmassol - (11:10): ahah  
sdumitriu - (11:10): It's also good for mouse input  
vmassol - (11:10): so it was a bug in js?  
sdumitriu - (11:10): (copy/paste with the mouse)  
sdumitriu - (11:10): Not quite a bug  
vmassol - (11:11): either selenium doesn't send teh correct events or it was bug , on?  
vmassol - (11:11): s/on/no/  
sdumitriu - (11:11): Selenium doesn't send the correct events  
vmassol - (11:12): ok.....  
vmassol - (11:12): so it's a workaround  
sdumitriu - (11:13): It's a workaround with added benefits  
vmassol - (11:19): indeed  
sburjan - (11:24): guys  
sburjan - (11:24): Hudson Server from Iasi (Windows Based) is DOWN  
sburjan - (11:25): Power Supply FAILED

sburjan - (14:42): tmortagne, : I'm trying to build xwiki-standards-validator and It's failing because of rome:rome:jar:1.0 (it's not found in the repository)  
sburjan - (14:43): Hudson made the last build 4 days ago  
tmortagne - (14:43): sburjan: that's weird if rome as been removed  
tmortagne - (14:43): i will check  
tmortagne - (14:44): indeed i can't find it on http://repo1.maven.org/maven2/rome/rome/  
tmortagne - (14:44): but there is previous versions..  
sburjan - (14:45): maybe we could publish it to the maven.xwiki.org  
tmortagne - (14:45): we will probably have to put it on our repository or we say that xwiki-standards-validator depends on Java 6 (which includes ROME)  
sburjan - (14:46): sorinello@Falcon:~/svn/platform/trunks/tools/xwiki-standards-validator$ java -version  
sburjan - (14:46): java version "1.6.0\_20"  
sburjan - (14:46): Java(TM) SE Runtime Environment (build 1.6.0\_20-b02)  
sburjan - (14:46): Java HotSpot(TM) Server VM (build 16.3-b01, mixed mode)  
sburjan - (14:46): I should have it ..  
tmortagne - (14:47): sburjan: it's not the same thing  
tmortagne - (14:47): we indicate explicitely to maven that it depends on something called rome:rome:jar:1.0  
tmortagne - (14:47): so it tries to find it  
tmortagne - (14:48): we would have to remove this dependency from the pom  
tmortagne - (14:48): and then say that you have to use Java 6  
tmortagne - (14:48): but for now i will just put rome in our repository  
sburjan - (14:51): let me know when you have uploaded the jar file  
tmortagne - (14:53): done  
sburjan - (14:53): thanks  
sburjan - (15:07): I wonder why it got removed from maven central  
tmortagne - (15:18): sburjan: maybe because 1.0 is the version included in Java 6 and Java 5 is supposed to be "dead"  
tmortagne - (15:18): officially at least ;)  
sburjan - (15:20): you mean included in the java JDK ?  
sburjan - (15:20): or JVM ?  
tmortagne - (15:20): sburjan: i mean in the JVM  
sburjan - (15:21): oh I see  
tmortagne - (15:21): and the JDK obviously  
sburjan - (15:21): this is forcing people to switch to Java 6 :)  
tmortagne - (15:21): like derby  
tmortagne - (15:21): (now called javadb)  
sburjan - (15:21): yeah...  
sburjan - (15:21): but I have Java VM installed.. but not from SUN  
sburjan - (15:21): java 6  
sburjan - (15:22): and this isn;t included  
tmortagne - (15:22): hmm  
tmortagne - (15:22): maybe i'm micing with something else  
tmortagne - (15:22): not a big user of ROME :)  
tmortagne - (15:22): s/micing/mixing/  
sburjan - (15:22): I heard of ROME 3 hours ago :))  
tmortagne - (15:23): anyway it's fixed now  
evalica left at 15:32 (Read error: Connection reset by peer  
sdumitriu - (15:46): Doing some profiling  
sdumitriu - (15:46): Looks weird  
sdumitriu - (15:47): Velocity is eating up a lot of memory  
sdumitriu - (15:47): 150.000 org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.Token objects  
sdumitriu - (15:47): So somebody is caching way too many parser results  
sdumitriu - (15:48): vmassol: Any ideas?  
sburjan - (16:07): :)  
sdumitriu - (16:09): We need instant chat in XWiki  
sdumitriu - (16:09): That way I can tell bozos to stop doing weird stuff  
sburjan - (16:10): maybe he's a spammer  
sdumitriu - (16:10): No, most likely just trying out stuff  
sburjan - (16:10): there is a 8mb swfflash  
sburjan - (16:11): with some tutorial regarding wiki  
sdumitriu - (16:11): Yep, it's an old demo  
vmassol - (16:12): otp  
sburjan - (16:14): lol  
sburjan - (16:14): you shoul roll back  
sburjan - (16:15): the main page is trashed  
sdumitriu - (16:15): Done  
sdumitriu - (16:16): OK, I'm kicking him out  
sburjan - (16:16): :)) doesn't seem to understand what he's doing  
sburjan left at 16:21 (Quit: Ex-Chat  
vmassol - (16:27): I've removed his edits on PageEditing  
sdumitriu - (16:27): Yeah, was wondering where they went  
vmassol - (16:28): sdumitriu: re velocity and memory, I don't know, my changes should have improved it normally

arkub left at 17:40 (Ping timeout: 240 seconds  
vmassol - (17:49): tmortagne: why is this a duplicate: http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XWIKI-5081 ?  
vmassol - (17:49): http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XWIKI-3961 is about PR  
vmassol - (17:49): I had created 2 issues  
tmortagne - (17:50): vmassol: it's the same issue IMO: make copy working with the proper rights  
vmassol - (17:50): not a big deal but I don't want that we forget to fix this  
vmassol - (17:50): ok then you need to rename and change the desqcription a bit  
tmortagne - (17:50): i.e. if you have rights on the source and the target you can copy  
vmassol - (17:50): I'm fine if you change the description  
vmassol - (17:51): just make sure the info isn't lost that PR and delete right is what is currently checked against  
tmortagne - (17:52): vmassol: sure but anyway if you can copy with the proper it means delete and PR wrong right are fixed  
florinciu joined #xwiki at 17:54  
vmassol - (18:21): sdumitriu: any luck in finding out the velocity memory issue? Was this done in a local XE instance or on myxwiki.org?  
sdumitriu - (18:21): local  
vmassol - (18:22): if you do the same in XE 2.2.x do you get less memory used?

vmassol - (19:32): 2010-07-05 12:19:58,991 [http://playground.myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/AllDocs%5D%20WARN%20%C2%A0web.XWikiMessageTool%20%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0-%20The%20document%20%5BWikiResources.Translations] is listed as an internationalization document bundle but it does not exist.  
vmassol - (19:32): there seems to be 10 such logs per millisecond

vmassol - (19:34): hmm I don't see any doc resource bundle in playground.myxwiki.org  
vmassol - (19:37): has anyone removed it?  
sdumitriu - (19:44): Not me
